Package de.oth.blocklib.world.fluids.Simple

Class Fluid

java.lang.Object
de.oth.blocklib.world.fluids.Simple.Fluid
public class Fluid
extends java.lang.Object
Represents a fluid (e.g. lava, water etc.) Spawns and removes water block. Triggers drawing of fluids.
Author:
Marius Tuschl, Florian Loher

  • Constructor Details

    • Fluid

      public Fluid​(short type, float updateTime, UIColor color, boolean withoutMesh)
      Creates a new type of SimpleFluid.
      Parameters:
      type - The type of the fluid (e.g "lava")
      updateTime - States in what intervals the fluid should be updated. A higher value results in less required performance but makes a fluid seem less liquid

  • Method Details

    • addBlocksToUpdate

      public void addBlocksToUpdate​(java.util.List<FluidBlock> blocks)
      Adds all blocks in the provided list to the queue of blocks that will be updated.
      Parameters:
      blocks - The list of blocks that is to be updated.

    • update

      public void update​(float deltaTime)
      Called from main game loop. Calculates state and draws the liquid.
      Parameters:
      deltaTime - Time elapsed since last update

    • submerge

      public void submerge​(boolean submerged)
      Sets all meshes into submerged state. This causes all polygons to be drawn in reverse, hence making them visible from the other side. Update 01.09.2021: Also updates breath bar if player is submerged
      Parameters:
      submerged - Flag if camera is submerged.

      Returns:

    • remove

      public void remove​(Vector3i position)
      Removes a fluid from given position. finalState has to be set to re-trigger calculations of future states
      Parameters:
      position - Position at which to remove a fluid.

    • removeBlock

      private void removeBlock​(FluidBlock cur)
      Removes a fluid block if it is empty. Else decrease distance until first condition is met.
      Parameters:
      cur - Block being worked on

    • getCount

      public int getCount()
      Only used for debugging/performance measures.
      Returns:
      How many blocks the fluid consists of.

    • getType

      public short getType()
      Returns type of fluid (block id).
      Returns:
      Block id of fluid

    • flow

      private void flow​(FluidBlock cur, Vector3i direction)
      Flow into next block in given direction. This creates a new fluid block in given direction. If there already is a fluid block the lowest distance will be chosen.
      Parameters:
      cur - Current block
      direction - Direction to flow to

    • canFlowTo

      private boolean canFlowTo​(short fluidLevel, Vector3i position, Vector3i direction)
      Checks whether given block can flow into given direction
      Parameters:
      fluidLevel - Current fluid level
      direction - Direction to flow to
      Returns:
      true if it is possible to flow there, else false

    • createFluidBlockAt

      public void createFluidBlockAt​(Vector3i position, Vector2i flowDirection, short fluidLevel)
      Same as createFluidBlockAt(FluidBlock) but uses position, flowDirection and flowDirection for creation.
      Parameters:
      position - The location where the block is to be put.
      flowDirection - The direction in which the fluid flows.
      fluidLevel - The height of the fluid.

    • put

      private void put​(FluidBlock block)
      Adds a block to the data structure. The fluidBlocks HashMap is later used to draw the contained blocks.
      Parameters:
      block - Value

    • isLedgeBlock

      private boolean isLedgeBlock​(FluidBlock fluidBlock)

    • isAir

      private boolean isAir​(Vector3i position)
      Returns whether given position is air (= no block)
      Parameters:
      position - Position at which should be checked whether there is a block.
      Returns:
      true if position is air, else false

    • createFluidBlockAt

      public void createFluidBlockAt​(FluidBlock fluidBlock)
      Creates a given FluidBlock, if the position of the fluidBlock is air. Otherwise does nothing.
      Parameters:
      fluidBlock - The FluidBlock that is to be put into the world.

    • insideRenderDistance

      private boolean insideRenderDistance​(FluidBlock block)
      Returns true if fluid block is within rendering distance
      Parameters:
      block - Currently to be rendered block
      Returns:
      true if within render distance, else false

    • flowDown

      private void flowDown​(FluidBlock cur)
      When water flows down a new source is created. This method simply checks whether the block is falling, that is being spawned in the air and is now falling until it reaches a block it can flow on. If it is falling it removes the block at current position and places a new one just below. If it is not falling then it happened due to a flow in water itself and therefore the block can not be removed. If one would remove the block there would be a gap in the water.
      Parameters:
      cur - Current block

    • closestDrop

      private boolean[] closestDrop​(FluidBlock cur)
      Looks for possible edges to flow down in all directions around the current block.
      Parameters:
      cur - Current fluid block
      Returns:
      Direction in which the closest drop is

      private Vector3i calculateFlowDirection​(FluidBlock cur, Vector3i direction)

      private boolean isTerrainBlockAt​(Vector3i position)
